intro: Ptychotis leptophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf ptychotis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Native to the western United States, it typically grows in dry, rocky habitats. The plant has a taproot system and is often found in open woodlands or grasslands. Its botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
